title: IEA: Coal Outpaces Gas in OECD Power Mix as "Bridge Fuel" Falters
summary: The global energy transition displayed a stark duality in September 2025, as a record-breaking surge in solar power generation clashed with the stubborn persistence of coal consumption across major economies. title: The Real Reason Behind U.S. Resuming Iraqi Kurdistan Oil Imports
summary: An oil tanker carrying crude from the Kurdistan Region of Iraq (KRI) unloaded its cargo at a U.S. port at the very end of last month – the first since the reopening of the critical Iraq-Turkey Pipeline (ITP) around two months ago. title: Will the Oil Curse Strike South America’s Wealthiest Country?
summary: In a remarkable turnaround, the tiny South American country of Guyana, once one of the continent’s poorest nations, now ranks among the world’s top 10 wealthiest countries by gross domestic product (GDP) per capita. title: U.S. Wants EU to Exempt Its LNG from Methane Regulation
summary: The United States insists that the European Union exempt it from obligations to report data under the EU Methane Regulation until 2035, Reuters reported on Monday, citing a U.S. document circulated to EU governments.
